alert.note: Alert for North Snowy Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 24 at 3:16AM MST until December 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW EXPECTED FOR THE MOUNTAINS TODAY THROUGH EARLY THIS WEEKEND... ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Near blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 7 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 65 mph early...decreasing to 30 mph after 2 AM Friday. * WHERE...North Snowy Range Foothills to include Arlington and Elk Mountain. * WHEN...Until 11 AM Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Near zero visibility in snow and blowing snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
